The journalist stays relentless... JOURNALIST (CONT’D) And how have you managed to stay so consistent in your investments? Is it true you guarantee returns?
There is no way to guarantee returns.  Who told you that?
Mike is standing in front of a projector screen in this s conference room. Peter Donnelly is standing in the back of the room with h crossed. Mike is explaining what he thinks our guys are doing...

Basically...what I believe...is that it's a form of online banking, but they use their own program and their own database. For instance, if someone gives them one hundred thousand dollars, they create an “account" for this person. With this "account" the investor can check their balance, can check their gains, losses etc. But what I believe they're doing...is setting up invisible money. This account...this number...is just that...a number. It has no monetary representation. They actually deposit the investment into their own account.
Then how do they give returns to their investors?

Well, that's it right there. They're feeding money from investor to investor. In achain. So when they give their investors the returns, they are actually depositing money into that person's account, but it is only a small percentage of what that person invested. So technically, as long as the investor never decides to walk away, they could be funneling their own money back to them forever.  The group
Now, is any of this information backed up? Confirmed?
It's just speculation at this point, sir. sighs.

Don't bother us anymore with speculation...get some facts. Alright, who's next?! Peter walks down the aisle toward the front of the room. Mike starts breathing hard, getting more and more frustra until he bursts out...
I’m not done! Peter pauses in his tracks.
What?

I’m not done! This is priority! This is a high-technology crime! Maybe you’re not briefed enough on this material Peter but let me tell you..this is the twenty-first century and the biggest wars we have are the cyber-wars! Addressing the rest of the officials in the room...

Please cover your ears--I’m about to start cussing now. (a beat) Sit your fucking ass over in that motherfucking chair Northcutt! Mike pauses and then walks over to his chair and sits dow Peter wanders over to the projector screen, examines it a turns around.

First off, you ever call me Peter again and I’ll rip your nose off your fucking face. You address me as “sir” or you address me as Mister Donnelly. I may be attractive and youthful but I have earned my status as “Mister.” You got that? Mike doesn’t react.

Issue number two..we are not in the business of skepticism Mike. We are in the business of fact. And I like facts. Facts don’t fucking lie, and the only facts you have right now, Mike, Mike Northcutt, is that you are a novice fucking official that enjoys raising his voice to heads of criminal investigative divisions. (he begins pacing the aisles) A man is shot with a bullet equals fact. A car crashes into a telephone pole equals fact. Tears are wet, fire is hot, ice is cold, fact, fact, and fact. You have no facts son, you have skepticism and the world is not run that way and neither is the Federal Bureau of Investigation. This may be the wrong Unit for you. Maybe you should transfer to Cyber Division and handle internet Fraud? You know where they’re stationed? (changing tones) Do you wanna know where they’re stationed? You want to be in the criminal investigative division? This division? You need to do some criminal investigating. You need to get tangible evidence. So let me say it one more time, Mikey, and I hope you can contain your tears. Don’t bother us again with speculation—get some facts. (he heads toward the door) Now all of you go turn your teeth into fucking fangs and start making some arrests. cut TO:

We travel around the call room, listening to different p from telemarketers. We end on Richard, as he sits there, forward, looking kind of nervous. Behind him...Levi stand the doorway with his arms crossed. After a moment, we suddenly see Andrew rush down the hall
Levi! Levi turns.
What's wrong?
Tan'el's on the phone...it's not good.
Levi rushes into Andrew's office, picks up the phone...
Mr. Garcia! How are you?
Tan'el paces back and forth in his living room, talking t on his cell phone.
Not good, not good.
Why?
I know I promised to invest but...I'm sorry...I need my money back...
Levi mouths "shit" and sits down in Andrew's chair.
Can you explain why?
I understand if you've already invested some of it...that's fine...keep it...but...the rest of the capitol I need back.
You gettin' cold feet? C'mon, what changed?
I had a few...deals...that...got fucked up...I lost some money. I'm not trying to dance around this, I need my money back.
Well, just so you know, we're looking at some big returns very soon for you. We plan on tripling your money!
That's all good, but, at this moment, I'm putting together something that requires the extra money...I will eventually be able to reinvest with you gentlemen, but right now...
Okay, okay. How about this? Let me and my partners come back down there, down to Mexico- Andrew shoots him an awkward look.
And we'll sit down with you and work out how we can continue our business together. Tan'el takes a deep breath...
Well...I don't know if it'll change anything...but...you wanna come down to my city? I won't turn you away.

Then we're getting on a plane right now. You're important to us Mr.  Garcia. You're our most important client and we don't want to lose your business. (pause) Okay, sir. See you soon. Bye. He hangs up, rubs his head, Andrew is silent.
Levi and Andrew walk down this private runway and over to private plane. They're dressed in nice suits. Andrew is talking to Travis on the phone...
Where are you? (pause) No, we can’t wait! You supposed to be here thirty minutes ago! (pause) Just stay there with Billy. (pause) Bye. He hangs up. ANDREW (CONT’D) Travis isn’t coming.
What are we gonna do with that kid?
He was our connection to Tan’el.
Doesn’t matter now.

Billy is leaning back in his chair, zoning out. He's taki pieces of computer paper, crushing them into little balls trying to shoot it into the waste basket near the door. H a few times and misses. He stretches, takes a deep breath, bored.
The plane comes to a smooth stop on the runway. Our guys get out and are met with Tan'el's assistant, sta next to the same limousine as before. They all shake his hand and get in.

Tan'el is sitting in a lawn chair in the back of the ranc wearing a wife-beater, smoking a cigar, and shooting a ri at a few targets. He fires...BANG! Misses. He reloads. BANG! BANG! He misse again. He squints, trying to see if he hit it or not. After a moment, our guys turn the corner, being led by th assistant. Tan'el hears them and turns...
Oopa!
How you doin' sir?
Good, good. Where's Travis?
He's back home. Changing subjects...
You a good shot? Tan'el looks down at his rifle.
One of the best! He clearly is terrible.
Can I try?

Sure, sure. He hands the gun to Levi. Levi grabs it, seems comfortabl the rifle, walks over in front of the lawn chair, quickly it, points it at a target...BANG! BANG! BANG! He hits thr straight targets. Tan'el tries to not look impressed.
Good, good. Almost as good as me!
I'm trying.
Billy is still hanging out in the office. He looks at his then gets up, grabs his jacket, and leaves.
Andrew is holding the gun now, looking down the sight. He fires...misses...fires...misses.
You suck, Andrew.
Shut up. He lowers the gun...
This seems like a pretty good bargaining tool.
It is, it is. I use it in all my negotiations! They laugh.
So...you have my money? Silence...a beat.  Finally...
Well, that's why we wanted to come down here.
We really want you to continue to work with us.
I already explained this. I need that money.
Let's try to figure something out that works for both of us. Tan'el calmly reaches out for the rifle.
(quietly) Can I see that for a moment? Andrwe hands it to him. Tan'el quickly grabs it and points it right at Levi's hea
Give me my money. Levi nervously smiles.
Billy, hands in his pockets, wanders down the street. He passes a deli, stops, and heads inside.
Everyone is a good shot when they're standing an inch from their target. I don't think I can miss from here.
Just calm down, calm down.
Let's talk about this.
I made a mistake. I was too quick to invest with you gentlemen. Too stupid.
We can make you money. Just give us time.
No! If my money is not in my account by next weekend...I will kill you. Is that clear? Is that English? I can tell you in Spanish if you want?
Well, this wasn't much of a negotiation, was it?
No...
Give us two weeks. And just the rest of the capitol.
Why two weeks? Why more time?
We have to organize our accounts.
Yeah, crunch some numbers.
Okay, two weeks. He lowers the gun and smiles.

Billy looks over the menu, orders, pays, and takes his se a table about ten feet away. He's looking at his cell pho As he's looking at his phone, a MAN enters through the fr entrance. Billy hears him, but doesn't look up.
Hey, Walter, how ya doin'? Billy finally looks up, sees Walter and does a double tak recognizes him and realizes he's going by a different nam
(smirking) Hey, Jonathan... Walter snaps his head over to him, gives a surprised expr and quickly turns back to the cashier. Billy flashes a huge smile, knows he was spying on them.
Nice one.
Andrew and Levi walk down the runway. Levi has his phone to his ear...
Billy, what's up?
You guys landed yet?
We're just taking off. Be there in a few hours.
Okay...well...when you land...I need you guys to come over to my house.
Why?
I'll explain when you get here. He hangs up.  Levi lowers the cell phone, looks oddly over at Andrew.
They walk up to the front door and knock. After only a mo Billy rips the door open, he's biting his nails.
Hey.
So what's going, Billy?
I have to show you something. The guys look confused. Billy turns and leads them throug house and over to a bedroom. They open the door next to him...
Sitting there on the far side of the room is Walter, a bl around his eyes, his mouth bleeding, and his arms tied be his back. Andrew quickly slams the door shut again...
What the hell is that?!
That's Walter, man.
Walter?!
He's F.B.I. He was spying on us.
What are you talking about?!
Remember Jonathan Mitchell? The investor of that accounting firm we met last week?
Yes.
That's him!
So why the hell is he tied up in your house, Billy?
I didn't know what to do.
Oh my god. Andrew walks away, rubs his forehead.
Billy, Billy...listen to me for a second. Did anyone see you bring this guy here?
No way.
Are you sure about that?
Yes, positive.
What the hell were you thinking?
I was thinking I was gonna save our asses by catching a spy!
This is insane.
But Billy...what do we do now, huh?
I don't know!
Dammit.
Where’s Travis? Does he know about this?
He didn’t answer.

Billy...I appreciate you looking out for us. I know you thought this was the right thing to do, but this was not the right thing to do. This was the wrong thing to do. Billy rubs his eyes. Andrew opens the door again and studies Walter...
Is he knocked out?
Yeah, I think so. I hit him pretty hard.
So let's just dump him somewhere.
Then he'll just come back and arrest us.
No, no. I blindfolded him right away, he doesn't know where he is.
Will he recognize you from our company?
I don't think so.
You don't think so?
Yeah. He only saw me for a moment. He probably won't remember anything.  Andrew closes the door.
We need to worry about Tan'el right now, we don't have time to think about a freaking hostage!
Billy's gonna handle this.
How?
How?
Yeah.
You're gonna fuckin' dump him back off somewhere, somewhere in this desert so no one sees your ass doing it.
walright...okay.
Got it?
Yeah, got it.
Somebody call Travis!

All is quiet until...Billy's flies by and screeches to a No one is around. Billy quickly jumps out and walks around to the side of t He opens the door, grabs Walter by the arms and drags him into the desert.
What the hell?! You better run! You're going to jail for a long time, son! His blindfold is still on, he has no clue who Billy is...
Sure about that? Billy jumps into the driver's seat and takes off. Walter tries to get to his feet, but trips and falls.
Our guys sit around the room. Andrew's pacing back and forth. Travis is there.
Tan'el... No one says anything.

There's nothing we can do with him. We have to bite the bullet on this one. Cut our spending and continue to push forward, finding more people. We haven't even asked any clients to refer us yet. We should work those connections more. A beat...
Tan'el...what if...what if we killed him...kept the money.
Are you fuckin' serious? Levi get you on that coke or what?
First of all, fuck off. Secondly, that's not a bad idea, Travis. Billy doesn't say anything.
Are you insane?!
You wouldn't kill him for ten million dollars?
No! What the-where the hell am I?
It's definitely intriguing.
Intriguing?! You plan to just walk in there, say "hey, howya' doin?" and then cap his ass? You don't think anyone's gonna have a problem with that?
Well, obviously, we'd be smarter about it than that.
What would you do for ten million dollars, Andrew? He doesn't respond.
(overly articulate) What would you do for ten million dollars, Andrew? Tell me.
Shit...I don't know! Not murder!
Then I'll do it, or Levi, or Billy.
We see Tan'el smoking a cigar, laughing, and then Levi, and Billy come up behind him. Levi draws a gun and POINTS AT HIM. ON THE SOUND OF THE TRIGGER WE CUT BACK TO...
Silence. Silence.
You stay here, be a pussy.
I don't consider that being a pussy you head-case. I consider that rational thinking.
Travis is right though...you don't have to be involved.
I'm involved no matter what, so stop saying that. If I know about it, and I don't stop it, I'm involved.
I just don't see any other way.
How about giving him his money back? (a beat) We wire him his ten mill, we suck it up, and move on. We haven't spent that much of it any way.
Right?
Look, I gotta get out of here. I'm not having this conversation.
Now you quitting? Andrew stops... A beat.
(mockingly) You can't quit, right? This isa mafia...blood in... No one responds. He leaves.
You don't really wanna murder Tan'el, do you? Travis leans back in his chair.
I think it should be an option.
I'm worried about Andrew, I am.
You don't need to be.
I don't know...I mean...I thought I was feelin' skeptical but Andrew...I think everything's starting to get to him. What if he tells someone?
Well, then we'll probably know about it.
What do you mean?
(frankly) I tapped his phones and miked his house.
What? Are you kidding?
No. I'm serious.
Why?!
Wait-You tap my shit?
No.
You're a liar.
I didn't, Travis! I trust you. Andrew, I don't trust. Not lately.
I don't like that, man. That's fucked up.
I'm lookin' out for us, okay?
When did you tap his phones?
Same time I did Richard's. If he's so trust worthy then we should have nothing to worry about, right? Levi's point kind of makes sense. The group sits in silence.
Heather sits on the floor, looking at some CD's. She pops one into the stereo and turns it upa little bit. Andrew walks in the front door. He's slouching, looks tir Heather hears him...
Hey baby. He wanders into the living room...
What are you doing?
Just listening to some music. He collapses onto the couch.
Some day, I bet we won't even have CD's.
What do you mean?
Well, first we had records, then tapes, now CD's, I mean it's the year two thousand, I'm sure they're gonna think of something.
Maybe like a little CD player, but it has all your music without putting any CD's in.
That's just crazy. She laughs.
Whatever.

Wasn't it weird how everyone thought Y2K was gonna be the end of the world? Everyone bought all this canned food, searched for bomb shelters, and then the clock struck midnight and nothing fuckin' happened. Nothing. How can people be so wrong about something? Just completely wrong.
I was worried.
No way! You were?
A little bit. You weren't?
Nope.
You know, you think you're a tough guy, but I know you're really just a big baby.
(playfully) Dem's fightin' words.
I could take you.
Really, huh? She gets up and jumps on him. They wrestle for a moment and it ends with Andrew holding
So, where are we having the wedding? We haven't even decided yet. Andrew grows serious...
Well...
How about...Jamaica? He doesn't respond.
Okay, not Jamaica. He takes a deep breath.
We might have to push it back for awhile. She perks up and turns to him...
Why?
Well...we had some...problems...at work.
What kind of problems?
We lost some money. Heather looks concerned.
What happened?
I don't wanna get into it...but... I just want you to know that I'm trying to give you the wedding of your dreams...I wanna make sure it's perfect. So I'm going to need more time.
Can you tell me what happened? He takes another breath...
Remember that big investment we got? Well, we lost it.
You lost it? How?
We had to give it back. He gets up and starts pacing, getting increasingly stress
I really didn't wanna talk about this.
If we're going to get married, I deserve to know everything about your life, don't I?
Yes, but...
You can talk to your wife, Andrew. What are you hiding?
I'm not hiding anything.
Sure sounds like it.
It's just...complicated...
I want to trust you. I have to trust you...you have to trust me.
I trust you.
Then tell me what's going on. He turns to her. He's about to crack.
Everything I do...I'm not perfect...I've made mistakes...but I think...I don't know...I'm sick of being the bad guy.
Bad guy?
What I'm about to tell you, you can't repeat, you can't question, and I want you to know that I'm trying to make it right. Okay?
Okay. You can trust me.
I can trust you?
Of course. I love you.
Well, I'm telling you this because I love you too. I love you more than anything.
Just tell me. He walks over and sits down next to her...

Our company...baby...our company is a fucking fraud. We don't invest, we're not stock brokers, we're frauds! What we do...we take peoples investments and then pay them back small portions of their own money pretending it's their interest. But there is no fucking interest! We're spending their money!
But...how...wouldn't you run out?

Not if you keep getting investors! Especially if the investments keep getting bigger! And we keep getting them! Baby...we're stealing their money! This house is stolen! Everything in here! Everything I buy you! It's all a scam, baby! He gets up and starts pacing. He notices she's starting to get nervous.
But Heather...see...the only reason I'm telling you this is because I'm gonna stop, I'm quitting, I'm not gonna be a criminal anymore.
What if someone finds out?
No one's gonna find out, ever. No one knows. No one will ever know.
I think you should tell someone.
And go to jail?! Are you insane?!
Are they gonna let you just walk away? Andrew ponders...
No, not exactly. I'm still figuring that out. Heather starts to tear up.
Heather--Don't cry. Everything's gonna be fine. Really. I promise.
I don't want anything to happen to you.
Nothing's gonna happen to me. We're going to be alright.
How are you gonna protect yourself? A beat.
There is one option...a backup plan...
What is it?
If all else fails, and I have to get out, if I need to do something drastic...
What?

There's this F.B.I. agent that's been trying to get information from us. He told us...he told Billy...that...he'd grant immunity to anyone who disclosed information about our company, if it lead to indictments.

head_text.subj: IS LISTENING TO THEIR CONVERSATION THROUGH THE MICROPHONE
WE FAINTLY HEAR ANDREW AND HEATHER CONTINUE TO TALK.
WE GET A SENSE THAT LEVI IS GOING TO HAVE A PROBLEM WITH

text: Andrew and Heather lie in bed -- Andrew is awake and star up at the ceiling. cut TO:
Levi is sitting under a street light, waiting. After a mo Travis and Billy wander up.
So what's this about? Levi pauses for a moment. Travis looks around...
What the fuck is goin' on?
We have a problem with Andrew.
What kind of problem?
A big problem...a really big problem.
Like what?
I have something I want you to hear. Levi walks toward the office building. Travis and Billy look at each, and finally, follow Levi t the building.
He brushes his teeth in front of the mirror, getting read a day of work. He takes an extra long look at himself in mirror.
Andrew, dressed in his suit, holding his suitcase, crosse through the parking garage. He seems nervous, breathing h

LONG TAKE -- He gets into the elevator, rides it up, gets and walks through the entire office. He passes Levi's off empty, passes Travis' office, empty, Billy's office, empt heads over to the conference room and opens the door...
Levi, Billy, and Travis sit around the conference table w serious expressions. They turn and stare at Andrew.
We having a meeting?  Levi nods. Andrew senses some tension in the air.
What's wrong?
(calmly) Can you close the door? Andrew closes the door. As he does, Levi stands up and smoothly takes out a gun a it right at Andrew's back. He turns around to see the gun freezes.
What the fuck?

Sit down. Andrew puts his hands up and wanders over to a chair. He sits down and Travis immediately whips out some duct t rips off a large piece and slaps it across Andrew's mouth jerks up but Billy grabs his arms and holds them behind t chair. Travis takes the rest of the duct tape and starts wrapping it around his body and the chair. Levi leans in...
Andrew, Andrew, Andrew. We have a problem. Andrew fights for a moment...
Do you know why we're doing this? He obviously can't respond...

I thought we were brothers. I thought we were family. We had a circle of trust here, Andrew. But you know what you did? You broke that bond. You  broke the motherfuckin' trust circle, Andrew. Andrew's eyes look confused.
You were gonna sell us out. You were gonna tell the F.B.I. and fuck us! He shakes his head furiously.

You can't deny that! I...hear...everything. I have tiny little eyeballs everywhere. This isn't easy for us, Andrew. This is hard....very, very hard. We don't wanna have to kill you...but...I think we have to. I think we have to kill your girl too. Andrew is breathing heavily, and in one big burst of stre tries to rip out of the duct tape. He kind of breaks some it, and Travis and Billy hold him back down.
Shit.
Use more duct tape, shit. Billy holds him down as Travis applies more tape.

Maybe I'm wrong here. Maybe I shouldn't kill you. Do you have a better idea? A better option? Cuz we don't. We're not going to jail, Andrew. We're not gonna let you sell us out. Andrew is trying to say something, we hear it muffled by tape.
Maybe we should let him say something. Levi thinks about it...finally...rips the duct tape off o mouth.  Andrew yells out in pain.
Talk, talk, talk.
(through breaths) I don't...know...what the hell you're talking about.
Andrew...I miked your house.
Huh?
I...miked...your...house. You were going to rat us out.
What? No! No, I wasn't!
We fucking heard you.
I wasn't serious! I would never do that! He motions to Travis to cover his mouth up again. Travis does...
No denying it now, sir. I'm sorry. Levi wanders over to the window.
You've put us in a very difficult position. He clutches his gun in his hands, calmly walks over to An and WHACK! He hits him in the face with the back of his g and knocks him out.

head_text.subj: WE HEAR A RUSTLING AROUND, BREATHING, FINALLY, BRIGHTNESS

text: Andrew was in the back of a trunk, his face bruised and c His hands are tied behind his back and he still has duct over his mouth. Billy has just popped the trunk. They're on top of a parking garage, no other cars around. Billy is leaning up against the car. He takes out a cigarette and lights it. Andrew squirms for a moment and then realizes he can't fr himself.

I don't know how we got here, man. I feel like I'm in a fucking nightmare...and I'm just waiting to wake up from this shit. (a beat) They're looking for Heather right now, Andrew. And me? I'm supposed to get rid of you. I'm supposed to kill you. I'm supposed to kill one of my best friends! Billy rubs his head. Andrew fights harder to untie himself but it's useless.

The first outlaws of the 21st century, huh? It sounds romantic...but...all this shit... everything we've been doing for the last two years...it's all fucked up. We're all insane, you know that? To do what we've been doing? You have to be wired a little differently up here to go through with any of this stuff. You know...my goal...was always just about making money...make as much money as you can...make all the money in the world...prove to people and myself that I could do it. Why? Probably cuz it was important to my  parents, I guess. But, one day I finally realized that isn't what makes me happy. I still don't know what does though...I'm still trying to figure that out. (a beat) You're one of my best friends, Andrew. I could never kill you...I could never kill anyone. Levi? Travis? They could kill. They might have already killed her. I don't know. But...that's for you to figure out I guess. He tosses his cigarette away, reaches over and helps Andr of the trunk. Andrew's feet and hands are tied and he col onto the ground. Billy stands over him...

I'm leaving, Andrew. Billy the Kid isn't gonna die young. Billy the Kid is running off into the sunset. You guys? I don't know what's going to happen. I don't wanna know. I don't wanna be here anymore. I wanna change, I wanna be somebody else, have a different life. He takes out a small knife and unties his feet and hands.
Wyatt Earp, huh? Good luck, man. Take care of yourself. He tosses Andrew's cellphone into his lap, rushes over to driver's seat and gets in. Andrew jumps up and rips the d tape off his mouth...
Billy! Wait! Where are they?! Where are they?! He jogs after the car but Billy quickly peels away and is He stops and looks down at his cellphone.
Andrew dials Heather's number, and rushes down the stairs He listens for a moment, but the answering clicks on...
Fuck! He continues down the stairs. Dials again...answering mac He reaches the bottom of the stairs and takes off into a speed sprint. Mid-stride, he dials again... No answer.

Andrew runs along the city street, breathing hard, sweati scanning the area for a taxi. He sees one and darts into the street to flag it down. He his arms wildly into the air. The taxi slams on its brake cut TO:
Levi and Travis are parked across the street waiting in t car. Travis lights a cigarette. They wait, not talking to each other, Levi's eyes fixed o front door. cut TO:

Andrew is breathing hard, continues to dial her number an no answer. He reaches into his pocket, grabs his wallet and opens i takes out Mike's business card and looks at it. Finally, he dials the number.
Hello? Mike Northcut? (pause) Yes, this is Andrew Thomas with the Phoenix Group. (pause) I have something to talk to you about.
The taxi pulls up to his house and Andrew jumps out. He d pay the driver and just runs toward the house.
Hey! You owe me... He trails off as Andrew reaches the front door. He opens was unlocked.
Heather?! He jogs into the kitchen, no one. He jogs into the living
Levi and Travis are standing there, Levi holding a gun... Andrew sees them and freezes...
What the...
Shit! I told you I should do it! Levi doesn't respond to him.
Where's my wife?
You tell me. We've been waiting for her.
Where's Billy?
He left.
What'd you mean "he left?"
He's gone! He bailed! He doesn't wanna be a part of this anymore... just like me. Levi raises his gun to Andrew...
Too bad. Andrew puts his hands up... Levi kind
You think me and Billy are the only ones who wanted out? Travis was gonna do the same thing I was!
Shut the fuck up.
I'm serious, Levi! He said you were getting out of control. of looks over at Travis...
Shoot him, please.
He told Billy too! He always hated that you were the leader! Remember?!
Gimme the gun, please, I'll shoot him.
What's he talking about?
He's trying to save his ass, what'd you think?! Fucking kill him, man, and lets get outta here!
It's the truth, Levi! Ask Billy! It's true! He always hated how you were Jesse James and shit, the leader...isn't that right Travis?
Shut your fucking mouth, Andrew. Levi! Gimme the gun! He lunges for it, but Levi steps back and points it at hi They freeze there for a moment.
What're you doing?
Maybe I should just kill both of you?
Yeah, fuckin' maybe. (a beat) You really gonna let him manipulate you like this? Are you that weak?
I forgot...do I trust you?
You're so fucking paranoid, man. Travis takes out a cigarette and lights it.
You need to figure some shit out for yourself, because if you can't trust me, you can't trust anyone.
Yeah, maybe I can't trust anyone.
You know...I always thought I had some problems...but...compared to you...
A car pulls up to the side garage...and out steps Heather
Is this what you wanted, Andrew? You wanted this thing to self-destruct? We were on top of the world, you realize that?
We still are... Suddenly, Heather crosses into the living room, sees them standing there, and SCREAMS! Her high-pitched scream startles Levi and he SHOOTS TRAVI
The bullet slices through Travis' chest, his cigarette dr from his mouth. In this instance, Andrew spins around, and grabs Heather.
Levi looks over at them but rushes over to Travis...
Shit! Shit! Travis is coughing up blood, as Levi leans down next to h
I didn't...mean...
(coughing) This feels...pretty real.
Andrew and Heather run out to her car...
